etymology.description: Depicts a spear handle wrapped in a leather strap -> signifies order/sequence -> extended meaning to 'younger brother'
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a spear or handle with an ordered wrapping, symbolizing sequence or hierarchy, which logically extends to reference a younger brother in a family structure.

examples.chinese: 我最喜欢跟弟一起玩(我最喜歡跟弟一起玩)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xǐhuān gēn dì yīqǐ wán.
examples.english: I most enjoy playing with my younger brother.

examples.chinese: 今天我带弟去公园(今天我帶弟去公園)，一起放风筝(一起放風箏)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān wǒ dài dì qù gōngyuán, yīqǐ fàng fēngzheng.
examples.english: Today, I take my younger brother to the park to fly kites together.
